Description: Wall fragment of Attic black-figured pottery cup; glazed on interior; outside: to left, panel frame of debased ivy leaves and vertical lines; to right part of incised circular object, too large to be a chariot wheel; dilute line at bottom of frieze, then reserved band above glazed lower body.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 57, no. 202 pl. 47)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1564)
